result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-2ND Offense and Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration-2ND Offense. The defendant was found guilty of Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-2ND Offense and the other charge, Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration-2ND Offense was dismissed by the court.

  • Donovan Charles Koeberl was found guilty of Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-2ND Offense, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration-2ND Offense

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant to report to the HOC by September 9, 2022 at 5:00 p.m.
 Huber release for employment and treatment.
Court ordered ignition interlock for a period for a period of 12 months. Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock.

AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Order For Intox Driver Assessment and Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample.
Fine set at $350.00.
All mandatory court costs, fees and assessments to be paid including DNA surcharge by August 30, 2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Restitution set at $0.00.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donovan Charles Koeberl in court.  Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary in court for Donovan Charles Koeberl.  Student Intern Kyle Elderkin under the supervision of Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea hearing proceeded.  

AS TO COUNT 1.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed. 

AS TO COUNT 3.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction as condition time; Huber release for employment and treatment; consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day served.  Defendant to report to the HOC by September 9, 2022 at 5:00 pm.

-Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 12 months.  
-Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 12 months. Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment..
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at $0.00.
-Fine set at $350.00
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid, including DNA surcharge, by August 30, 2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed: Sentencing Referral Form, Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Letter from Alliance Counseling Center.

Defendant Donovan Charles Koeberl in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Donovan Charles Koeberl in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Allysa Brown for James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.

Defendant Donovan Charles Koeberl in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
